title.narrative: Training in Agroecological Culture for the Rooting of the Indigenous Paí Tavytera of the Amamabay. N/A. description.narrative: APTR will work with approximately 17 indigenous communities in the departments of Amambay, Canindeyú, and San Pedro to improve agricultural production including cultivation and conservation of traditional seeds for better food security. APTR will also work with communities to protect their local environments, strengthen their cultural identities and enhance the association's own ability to represent community interests and advocate for rights under Paraguayan law. Approximately 1,600 people will benefit directly.. Asociación Paí Tavytera RekoPave in Paraguay (APTR) will work with 17 indigenous communities in Northern Paraguay to improve their agricultural production and cultivation of traditional seeds to become more food secure, protect their local environment, strengthen their cultural identity, and enhance the association¿s ability to represent its interests and advocate for its rights under Paraguayan law. Approximately 1,500 people will benefit directly and 5,200 people will benefit indirectly.. description.narrative: The Government of Paraguay is making significant advances in fighting corruption and impunity and eradicating extreme poverty. Encouraged by a recently approved Freedom of Information Law and widely available public notices, citizens are denouncing irregularities and sending a clear message that corruption will not be tolerated. Although high levels of income inequality remain, Paraguayan government programs are producing positive results in reducing poverty and in countering illicit activities in the northern region. U.S. assistance programs add momentum to these positive developments, helping Paraguay strengthen its democratic institutions and supporting more equitable and environmentally sustainable economic growth.
